entry.title: Platform update: Introducing New App Installation flow on Microsoft Teams
entry.summary:
We are excited to announce the enhanced user experience for Teams apps installed from Teams Store or via custom upload. With this update, the UI gets more intuitive, user-friendly, straightforward, and easy-to-navigate. Now, adding Teams app in the required scope is just a click away. Key features of this update include the ability to view the available scopes and the scope that gives the best usage experience of that app.

entry.title: App validation update: Ensure a secure and user-friendly experience for app users with Nested App Authentication
entry.summary:
Excited to introduce Nested app authentication (NAA) for single-page applications that are embedded in host environment. NAA ensures that users can seamlessly interact with integrated apps within a primary app. It offers all this while maintaining security and enhancing user experience without requiring multiple logins. Use NAA to enable Single Sign-On (SSO) for apps embedded within supported Microsoft apps. NAA improves security by offering better security and flexibility. This allows for the creation of rich, client-driven apps while ensuring a secure and user-friendly experience for app users.

entry.title: App validation update: Introduced App analytics for third-party apps in Developer Portal
entry.summary:
If you're an ISV developer, you now have the capability to access and analyze your app's usage metrics, including monthly, daily, and weekly data, through the Developer Portal. Additionally, you can import your existing or published apps to the Developer Portal to view detailed usage data, such as trends over time, usage by region or country, app usage across different host products and Microsoft 365 (M365) workloads, and the usage of various app capabilities. This enhancement aims to provide full visibility and explore app usage metrics to build better apps and to provide detailed insights into your app performance.
